question: What are the pharmacokinetics of Emtricitabine in HIV-infected pediatric subjects aged 13 to 17 years?
reference_answer: The pharmacokinetics of FTC at steady state were determined in 27 HIV-1-infected pediatric subjects 13 to 17 years of age receiving a daily dose of 6 mg/kg up to a maximum dose of 240 mg oral solution or a 200 mg capsule. Mean ± SD C and AUC were 2.7 ± 0.9 μg/mL and 12.6 ± 5.4 μg∙hr/mL, respectively.

Emtricitabine:
 
The pharmacokinetics of FTC at steady state were determined in 27 HIV-1-
infected pediatric subjects 13 to 17 years of age receiving a daily dose of 6 mg/kg up to
a maximum dose of 240 mg oral solution or a 200 mg capsule; 26 of 27 subjects in this
age group received the 200 mg capsule. Mean ± SD C
 and AUC were 2.7 ± 0.9
μg/mL and 12.6 ± 5.4 μg∙hr/mL, respectively. Exposures achieved in pediatric subjects
